reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports every 90 days, midterm briefing by 29 March 2007, interim report within 90 days, and final report 30 days prior to termination
summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions on Sudan, stresses its commitment to peace in Sudan, implementation of the Comprehensive Peace Agreement, and the Darfur Peace Agreement. It urges parties to sign and implement the Darfur Peace Agreement without delay. The Council deplores ongoing violence, impunity, and humanitarian situation deterioration, and calls for ceasefire. 

The Council commends efforts of the African Union, the Secretary-General, and regional leaders, and recalls the midterm briefing and final report of the Panel of Experts. It emphasizes respecting privileges and immunities of UN operations and persons. 

The Council reaffirms its commitment to Sudan's sovereignty, unity, and territorial integrity. Determining the situation in Sudan remains a threat to international peace and security, it acts under Chapter VII. 

The Council extends the Panel of Experts' mandate until 29 September 2007, requests the Secretary-General to appoint a fifth member, and outlines reporting requirements. It urges cooperation with the Committee and Panel, and decides to remain seized of the matter.
